<P style="margin:0px"><B>Cautionary Note Regarding Forward-Looking Statements 
</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>This Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q contains 
&#147;forward-looking information&#148; within the meaning of Canadian 
securities legislation and &#147;forward-looking statements&#148; within the 
meaning of the U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 
(collectively, &#147;forward-looking statements&#148;). &nbsp;Any statements 
that express or involve discussions with respect to business prospects, 
predictions, expectations, beliefs, plans, intentions, projections, objectives, 
strategies, assumptions, future events, performance or exploration and 
development efforts using words or phrases (including negative and grammatical 
variations) such as, but not limited to, &#147;expects,&#148; 
&#147;anticipates,&#148; &#147;plans,&#148; &#147;estimates,&#148; 
&#147;intends,&#148; &#147;forecasts,&#148; &#147;likely,&#148; 
&#147;projects,&#148; &#147;believes,&#148; &#147;seeks,&#148; or stating that 
certain actions, events or results &#147;may,&#148; &#147;could,&#148; 
&#147;would,&#148; &#147;should,&#148; &#147;might&#148; or &#147;will&#148; be 
taken, occur or be achieved are not statements of historical fact and may be 
forward-looking statements. &nbsp;Although we believe that our plans, intentions
and expectations reflected in these forward-looking statements are reasonable, 
we cannot be certain that these plans, intentions or expectations will be 
achieved. &nbsp;Actual results, performance or achievements could differ 
materially from those contemplated, expressed or implied by the forward-looking 
statements contained in this Quarterly Report. &nbsp;Forward-looking statements 
in this Quarterly Report include, but are not limited to, statements regarding 
the following:</P>
<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-
top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:72px; font-family:'Symbol';
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-
indent:-2px" align=justify>the insufficiency of our existing cash resources and 
working capital to enable us to continue our operations for the next 12 months 
as a going concern;</P>
<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-
top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:72px; font-family:'Symbol';
clear:left; float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-
indent:-2px" align=justify>the potential liquidation or sale of part or all of 
the Company&#146;s assets and the possible loss by investors of part or all of 
their investment;</P>
<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-
top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:72px; font-family:'Symbol';
clear:left; float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-
indent:-2px" align=justify>anticipated losses or gains in the operation of our 
business going forward;</P>
<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-
top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:72px; font-family:'Symbol';
clear:left; float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-
indent:-2px" align=justify>the narrowed focus or suspension of the 
Company&#146;s near-term operational and permitting activities; </P>
<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-
top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:72px; font-family:'Symbol';
clear:left; float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-
indent:-2px" align=justify>the pursuit of potential financing and strategic 
alternatives;</P>
<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-
top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:72px; font-family:'Symbol';
clear:left; float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-
indent:-2px" align=justify>expectations regarding the ability to raise capital 
or secure strategic partners and to continue development plans at our Bear Lodge
Rare Earth Element Project (&#147;Bear Lodge REE Project&#148; or the 
&#147;Project&#148;); and</P>
<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-
top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:72px; font-family:'Symbol';
clear:left; float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-
indent:-2px" align=justify>future expenditures to comply with environmental and 
other laws and regulations.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify>Forward-looking statements are 
subject to a variety of known and unknown risks, uncertainties and other factors
that could cause actual events or results to differ materially from our 
expectations and include, among others, the factors referenced in the &#147;Risk
Factors&#148; section of our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the period ended 
December 31, 2015, including, without limitation, risks associated with:</P>
<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-
top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:72px; font-family:'Symbol';
float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-
indent:-2px" align=justify>our ability to obtain additional financial resources 
on acceptable terms to (i) continue operating the Company, (ii) maintain our 
assets, (iii) conduct our Project activities and (iv) maintain our general and 
administrative expenditures at sustainable levels;</P>
<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-
top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:72px; font-family:'Symbol';
clear:left; float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-
indent:-2px" align=justify>depressed and volatile rare earth markets, including 
fluctuations in demand for, and prices of, rare earth products;</P>
<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-
top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:72px; font-family:'Symbol';
clear:left; float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-
indent:-2px" align=justify>our lack of production from our mineral properties, 
including the Bear Lodge REE Project;</P>
<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-
top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:72px; font-family:'Symbol';
clear:left; float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-
indent:-2px" align=justify>our history of losses and numerous uncertainties that
could affect the profitability or feasibility of the Bear Lodge REE Project;</P>
<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-
top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:72px; font-family:'Symbol';
clear:left; float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-
indent:-2px" align=justify>the potential outcome of a future feasibility study 
that may indicate Bear Lodge REE Project economics are less favorable;</P>
<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-
top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:72px; font-family:'Symbol';
clear:left; float:left">&#183;</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-
indent:-2px" align=justify>our ability to resume our currently suspended federal
and state permitting efforts in a timely and cost effective manner;</P>
<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-
top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:48px; width:72px; font-family:'Symbol';

<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-

Bear Lodge REE Project;</P>

<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-

<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-

<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-

<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-

including an increase in global supplies or predatory pricing and dumping by our
competitors;</P>
<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-

<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-

<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-

<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-
indent:-2px" align=justify>the specific product(s) from the Bear Lodge REE 
Project potentially having a limited number of potential customers, which could 
limit our bargaining power, product pricing, and profitability;</P>
<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-

<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-

<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-

<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-

processes for our planned operations; </P>
<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-

<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-

management;</P>
<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-

<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:72px; text-

<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-

<P style=margin-top:6.667px;margin-bottom:-1pt;font-size:1pt /><P style="margin-

<A NAME="RANGE!A1:F43"></A><P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center>See accompanying notes to consolidated 
interim financial statements</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center>6</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="margin:0px; page-break-before:always" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:24px; 
float:left"><B>1.</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:24px; padding-right:0.267px; text-indent:-
2px" align=justify><B>NATURE OF OPERATIONS</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:24px; padding-
right:0.267px" align=justify>Rare Element Resources Ltd. (collectively, 
&#147;we,&#148; &#147;us,&#148; &#147;Rare Element&#148; or the 
&#147;Company&#148;) was incorporated under the laws of the Province of British 
Columbia, Canada, on June 3, 1999.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:24px" align=justify>Rare Element has 
historically been focused on advancing the Bear Lodge Rare Earth Element 
(&#147;REE&#148;) Project located near the town of Sundance in northeast 
Wyoming. &nbsp;The Bear Lodge REE Project consists of several large disseminated
REE deposits and a proposed hydrometallurgical plant to be located near Upton, 
Wyoming. &nbsp;The Company previously announced extensive cost cutting measures 
and the placement of the Project on care-and-maintenance to position us to be 
able to move the Project forward when market conditions improve, while allowing 
us in the interim to pursue potential financings and strategic alternatives such
as off-take agreements, joint ventures and the potential sale of various assets 
and/or the Bear Lodge REE Project.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:24px" align=justify>The financial statements 
have been prepared on a going concern basis, which assumes the Company will be 
able to realize its assets and discharge its liabilities in the normal course of
business for the foreseeable future. &nbsp;The Company has incurred losses since
inception and further losses are anticipated in the development of its business,
raising substantial doubt about the Company&#146;s ability to continue as a 
going concern. &nbsp;The ability to continue as a going concern is dependent 
upon the Company obtaining the necessary financing to meet its obligations and 
pay its liabilities arising from normal business operations when they come due. 
&nbsp;Management intends to finance operating costs with existing cash on hand, 
asset sales and potential issuances of common stock. There can be no assurance 
that we will be able to raise the necessary financing or complete a strategic 
transaction on acceptable terms or at all. &nbsp;If we are unable to continue as
a going concern or in order to preserve shareholder value, we may have to 
liquidate our assets. If the Company decides to sell part or all of its assets, 
the sale proceeds may be less than the value at which those assets are carried 
on our consolidated financial statements. &nbsp;As a result, investors may lose 
part or all of their investment.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:24px; 
float:left"><B>2.</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:24px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B>BASIS OF PRESENTATION</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:24px; padding-
right:0.267px" align=justify>In accordance with U.S. GAAP for interim financial 
statements, these consolidated financial statements do not include certain 
information and note disclosures that are normally included in annual financial 
statements prepared in conformity with U.S. GAAP. &nbsp;Accordingly, these 
unaudited consolidated financial statements should be read in conjunction with 
our audited consolidated financial statements as of December 31, 2015, which 
were included in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the period ended December
31, 2015. In the opinion of management, the accompanying unaudited consolidated 
financial statements contain all adjustments (which are of a normal, recurring 
nature) necessary to present fairly in all material respects our financial 
position as of June 30, 2016, and the results of our operations and cash flows 
for the six months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015 in conformity with U.S. GAAP. 
&nbsp;Interim results of operations for the three and six months ended June 30, 
2016 may not be indicative of results that will be realized for the full year 
ending December 31, 2016.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:24px; padding-
right:0.267px" align=justify><I>Recent Accounting Pronouncements </I></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px; padding-left:24px; padding-
right:0.267px" align=justify>In August 2014, the Financial Accounting Standards 
Board (&#147;FASB&#148;) issued Accounting Standards Update (&#147;ASU&#148;) 
No. 2014-15, &#147;Presentation of Financial Statements-Going Concern (Subtopic 
205-40): Disclosure of Uncertainties about an Entity&#146;s Ability to Continue 
as a Going Concern&#148; (&#147;ASU 2014-15&#148;). ASU 2014-15 is intended to 
define management&#146;s responsibility to evaluate whether there is substantial
doubt about an organization&#146;s ability to continue as a going concern and to
provide related footnote disclosures. The amendments in this ASU are effective 
for reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2016, with early adoption 
permitted. &nbsp;Although we have not yet adopted ASU 2014-15, we plan to do so 
timely and will then determine if additional disclosures are required. We do not
expect its adoption to have a material impact on our financial statements. </P>
<A NAME="_1397995885"></A><P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:24px; 
float:left"><B>3.</B></P>

<A NAME="_1397995891"></A><P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; 
width:24px; float:left"><B>4.</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:24px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B>SHAREHOLDERS&#146; EQUITY</B></P>
<A NAME="_1397995892"></A><P style="margin:0px; clear:left" 
align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:24px" align=justify><B><I>Warrants</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:24px" align=justify>Each outstanding warrant 
is exercisable for one of the Company&#146;s common shares and was issued to 
investors in connection with registered direct offerings of the Company that 
closed on September 27, 2013 and April 29, 2015. In addition, the Company issued
warrants to a placement agent in connection with each offering, under the same 
terms as those issued to investors. The exercise price and exercise period are 
outlined below:</P>

<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:24px" align=justify>The value of the warrants
issued to the placement agent (non-employee) for its services in connection with
the April 29, 2015 offering was offset against the proceeds of the financing. 
&nbsp;The Company used a Black-Scholes option pricing model with inputs 
including a market price of the Company&#146;s stock of $0.72, an exercise price
of $0.85, a three-year term, volatility of 81.0%, a risk-free rate of 0.91% and 
no assumed dividends. &nbsp;The value of the warrants issued to the placement 
agent for its services in connection with the April 29, 2015 offering was 
estimated at $91.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:24px; 
float:left"><B>5.</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:24px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B>ADDITIONAL PAID-IN CAPITAL</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:24px" align=justify><B><I>Stock-based 
compensation</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:24px; padding-right:-2.4px" align=justify>We 
have options outstanding and exercisable that were issued under two plans, the 
Fixed Stock Option Plan (&#147;FSOP&#148;) and the 10% Rolling Stock Option Plan
(&#147;RSOP&#148;).</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:24px; padding-right:-2.4px" align=justify>The
FSOP was originally approved by shareholders on December 11, 2002, and 
subsequently approved by shareholders on December 7, 2009 following certain 
amendments to the FSOP. The FSOP expired upon the adoption of the RSOP that was 
approved by shareholders on December 2, 2011, and as such, we may no longer 
grant options under the FSOP. However, the terms of the FSOP continue to govern 
all prior awards granted under such plan until such awards have been cancelled, 
forfeited or exercised in accordance with the terms thereof. &nbsp;As of June 
30, 2016, we had 160,000 options outstanding under our FSOP, as amended, and 
3,127,400 options outstanding under our RSOP.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:24px" align=justify>The fair value of each 
employee stock option award is estimated at the grant date using a Black-Scholes
option pricing model and the price of our common shares on the date of grant. 
The Company did not issue any stock option awards during the six months ended 
June 30, 2016. The significant assumptions used to estimate the fair value of 
stock options awarded during the six months ended June 30, 2015, using a Black-
Scholes option pricing model are as follows:</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<TABLE style="margin-top:0px; font-size:10pt" cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 
align=center><TR height=0 style="font-size:0"><TD width=147.733 /><TD 
width=17.733 /><TD width=97.067 /></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-
right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px; background-color:#FFFFFF" width=147.733><P 
style="margin:0px" align=justify>&nbsp;</P>
</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-
right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px; background-color:#FFFFFF" width=17.733><P 
style="margin:0px" align=right>&nbsp;</P>
</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-
right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px; background-color:#FFFFFF; border-bottom:1px 
solid #000000" width=97.067><P style="margin:0px" align=center>June 30, 2015</P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-
right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px; background-color:#FFFFFF" valign=bottom 
width=147.733><P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Risk-free interest rate</P>
</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-
right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px; background-color:#FFFFFF" valign=bottom 
width=17.733><P style="margin:0px" align=center>&nbsp;</P>
</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-
right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px; background-color:#FFFFFF" valign=bottom 
width=97.067><P style="margin:0px" align=center>1.0% - 1.1% </P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-
right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px; background-color:#FFFFFF" valign=bottom 
width=147.733><P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Expected volatility</P>

<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:24px; padding-right:-2.4px" align=justify>The
compensation expense recognized in our consolidated financial statements for the
three months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015 for stock option awards was $23 and 
$48, respectively, and $56 and $130 for the six months ended June 30, 2016 and 
2015, respectively. &nbsp;As of June 30, 2016, there was $17 of total 
unrecognized compensation cost related to 264,200 unvested stock options that is
expected to be recognized over a weighted-average remaining vesting period of 
0.4 years.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR>

<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; width:24px; 
float:left"><B>6.</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:24px; text-indent:-2px" 
align=justify><B>COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES </B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:24px" align=justify>Our commitments and 
contingencies include the following item:</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:24px; padding-right:0.267px" 
align=justify><B><I>Potential environmental contingency</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:24px" align=justify>Our mining and 
exploration activities are subject to various federal and state laws and 
regulations governing the protection of the environment. &nbsp;These laws and 
regulations are continually changing and generally becoming more restrictive 
over time. &nbsp;The Company conducts its operations so as to protect public 
health and the environment and believes its operations are materially in 
compliance with all applicable laws and regulations. &nbsp;We have made, and 
expect to make in the future, expenditures to comply with such laws and 
regulations. &nbsp;The ultimate amount of reclamation and other future site-
restoration costs to be incurred for existing mining interests is uncertain.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center>9</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="margin:0px; page-break-before:always" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<A NAME="_Toc316545022"></A><A NAME="_Toc449456274"></A><A 
NAME="_Toc449520378"></A><P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px" 
align=justify><FONT style="font-family:'Times New Roman Bold,Times New 
Roman'"><B>ITEM 2. &nbsp;MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL 
CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS </B></FONT></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify>The following 
management&#146;s discussion and analysis of the consolidated financial results 
and condition of Rare Element Resources Ltd. (collectively, &#147;we,&#148; 
&#147;us,&#148; &#147;our,&#148; &#147;Rare Element&#148; or the 
&#147;Company&#148;) for the three and six months ended June 30, 2016, has been 
prepared based on information available to us as of August 2, 2016. This 
discussion should be read in conjunction with the unaudited Consolidated 
Financial Statements and notes thereto included herewith and the audited 
Consolidated Financial Statements of Rare Element for the period ended December 
31, 2015, and the related notes thereto filed with our Annual Report on Form 10-
K, which have been prepared in accordance with U.S. GAAP. This discussion and 
analysis contains forward-looking statements that involve risks, uncertainties 
and assumptions. &nbsp;Our actual results may differ materially from those 
anticipated in these forward-looking statements as a result of many factors, 
including, but not limited to, those set forth elsewhere in this report. See 
&#147;Cautionary Note Regarding Forward-Looking Statements.&#148;</P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B><I>All currency amounts are expressed in 
thousands of U.S. dollars, unless otherwise noted. &nbsp;</I></B></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B>Introduction</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify>Although the Company is 
currently in care-and-maintenance pending further financing, we have 
historically been focused on advancing to production the Bear Lodge REE Project 
in Wyoming.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B>Outlook </B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="line-height:12pt; margin:0px" align=justify>We have limited cash 
resources on hand and have reduced staff to one executive employee and 
implemented measures to conserve our remaining cash. &nbsp;The Company has 
narrowed the focus of its activities to only the very highest priority items 
that we believe have the greatest potential to preserve the value of the Project
and shareholder value, including seeking capital and actively pursuing potential
strategic alternatives, including off-take agreements, joint ventures, and the 
potential sale of various assets and/or the Project. The Company will 
additionally continue with certain limited reclamation activities in 2016 as 
required and appropriate. </P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B>Results of Operations</B> </P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B><I><U>Summary</U></I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Our consolidated net loss for the three 
months ended June 30, 2016 was $434, or $0.01 per share, compared with our 
consolidated net loss of $2,097, or $0.04 per share, for the same period in
2015. Our consolidated net loss for the six months ended June 30, 2016 was 
$2,270, or $0.04 per share, compared with our consolidated net loss of $4,572, 
or $0.09 per share, for the same period in 2015. </P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>For the three months ended June 30, 2016, 
the decrease in consolidated net loss of $1,663 from the prior period was 
primarily the result of a decrease in exploration and evaluation expenses of 
$1,164 and corporate administration expenses of $556.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>For the six months ended June 30, 2016, the 
decrease in consolidated net loss of $2,302 from the prior period was primarily 
the result of a decrease in exploration and evaluation expenses of $2,155, an 
increase in corporate administration expenses of $181 and a positive variance of
$286 related to currency translation</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B><I><U>Exploration and 
evaluation</U></I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Exploration and evaluation costs were $35 
and $162 for the three and six months ended June 30, 2016, respectively, as 
compared with $1,199 and $2,317 for the three and six months ended June 30, 
2015, respectively. The decrease from the prior period was the result of 
decreased activities on the Bear Lodge REE Project as we suspended the majority 
of permitting activities while continuing the work necessary to maintain our 
permits. </P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B><I><U>Corporate administration 
</U></I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<A NAME="A2208069Z10_K_HTM_PAGE_DW73101_1_115"></A><P style="margin:0px" 
align=justify>Corporate administration costs were $363 and $2,110 for the three 
and six months ended June 30, 2016, as compared with $919 and $1,929 for the 
three and six months ended June 30, 2015. During the six months ended June 30, 
2016, corporate administration includes one-time severance expenses incurred in 
placing the Project on care-and-maintenance and severing all but one of our 
full-time employees. Absent this non-recurring cost of approximately $950, 
corporate administration </P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center>10</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="margin:0px; page-break-before:always" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>costs would have been lower by approximately
$769 for the six months ended June 30, 2016. Corporate and administrative costs 
in the three and six months ended June 30, 2016 related to a voluntary delisting
from the New York Stock Exchange and listing on the OTCQB, outside legal 
expenses relating to our regulatory and proprietary patent-pending filings, and 
completing the remaining office lease obligations at our Lakewood, Colorado 
location.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B>Financial Position, Liquidity and Capital
Resources</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B><I>Operating Activities</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Net cash used in operating activities was 
$2,941 for the six months ended June 30, 2016, as compared with $4,819 for the 
same period in 2015. The decrease of $1,878 in cash used is primarily the result
of decreased spending on exploration and evaluation activities of approximately 
$2,155, partially offset by timing in vendor payments affecting accounts payable
which increased use of cash by $253 and increased corporate administration 
expenses of $246 (excluding non-cash stock-based compensation expenses).</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B><I>Investing Activities</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Net cash provided by investing activities 
was $89 for the six months ended June 30, 2016, as compared with net cash used 
of nil for the same period in 2015. The cash received in the 2016 period was 
related to the sale of small equipment and office furniture.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B><I>Financing Activities</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Net cash provided by financing activities 
was nil and $3,076 for the six months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015, 
respectively. &nbsp;The cash received in 2015 was the result of the 
Company&#146;s April 29, 2015 registered direct offering. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B>Liquidity and Capital Resources</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>At June 30, 2016, our total current assets 
were $1,091, as compared with $4,053 as of December 31, 2015, which is a 
decrease of $2,962. The decrease in total current assets is primarily due to a 
decrease in the combination of cash and cash equivalents of $2,852 as well as 
reduced prepaid expenses of $102.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Our working capital as at June 30, 2016 was 
$883, as compared with $2,992 at December 31, 2015. </P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:13.333px" align=justify>We have placed 
the Bear Lodge REE Project under care-and-maintenance, and all permitting 
activities have been suspended. &nbsp;Additionally, corporate cost containment 
measures have been implemented to preserve remaining cash balances as we pursue 
additional financing and/or strategic alternatives, including the sale of 
various assets and/or the Project.<B> </B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:13.333px" align=justify>We do not have 
sufficient funds to complete feasibility studies, permitting, development and 
construction of the Bear Lodge REE Project. &nbsp;Therefore, our continuation as
a going concern is dependent upon our completion of a future financing, off-take
agreement, joint venture, sale of various assets and/or the Bear Lodge REE 
Project or other strategic transaction. &nbsp;However, there is no assurance 
that we will be successful in completing such a financing or strategic 
transaction. &nbsp;As a result, there is substantial doubt as to whether our 
existing cash resources and working capital are sufficient to enable us to 
continue our operations for the next 12 months as a going concern.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>The accompanying financial statements have 
been prepared assuming that we will continue as a going concern. &nbsp;Our 
financial statements do not include any adjustments that may result from the 
outcome of this uncertainty. &nbsp;We do not have sufficient cash to fund 
planned operations and meet obligations for the next 12 months without raising 
additional funds.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>If we are unable to continue as a going 
concern or in order to preserve shareholder value, we may have to liquidate our 
assets, the proceeds from which may be less than the value at which those assets
are carried on our consolidated financial statements. &nbsp;As a result, 
investors may lose part or all of their investment.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B>Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>We have no off-balance sheet arrangements. 
</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center>11</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="margin:0px; page-break-before:always" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B>Contractual Obligations</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>There were no material changes to the 
contractual obligations disclosed in Item 7 of Part II in our Form 10-K for the 
period ended December 31, 2015.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<A NAME="_Toc316545025"></A><A NAME="_Toc449456275"></A><A 
NAME="_Toc449520379"></A><P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12.2px" 
align=justify><FONT style="font-family:'Times New Roman Bold,Times New 
Roman'"><B>ITEM 3. &nbsp;QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES ABOUT MARKET 
RISK</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B>Market risk. </B>Market risk is the risk 
that the fair value of future cash flows of a financial instrument will 
fluctuate because of changes in market prices. &nbsp;Our market risk is 
comprised of various types of risk: interest rate risk, commodity price risk and
other price risk.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B>Interest rate risk.</B> Our cash and cash
equivalents consist of cash held in bank accounts and, at times, guaranteed 
investment certificates that earn interest at variable interest rates. &nbsp;Due
to the short-term nature of these financial instruments, fluctuations in market 
rates did not have a significant impact on estimated fair values as of June 30, 
2016. &nbsp;Future cash flows from interest income on cash and cash equivalents 
will be affected by interest rate fluctuations. &nbsp;We manage interest rate 
risk by maintaining an investment policy that focuses primarily on preservation 
of capital and liquidity.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-right:-1.467px" align=justify><B>Commodity price 
risk</B>. We are indirectly exposed to commodity price risk of rare earth 
products, which are, in turn, influenced by the price of and demand for the end 
products produced with rare earth mineral resources. A significant decrease in 
the global demand for these products may have a material adverse effect on our 
business. None of our mineral properties are in production, and we do not 
currently hold any commodity derivative positions.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B>Other price risk.</B> Other price risk is
the risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will
fluctuate because of changes in market prices, other than those arising from 
interest rate risk, or commodity price risk.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<A NAME="_Toc316545026"></A><A NAME="_Toc449456276"></A><A 
NAME="_Toc449520380"></A><P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12.2px" 
align=justify><FONT style="font-family:'Times New Roman Bold,Times New 
Roman'"><B>ITEM 4. &nbsp;CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B>Disclosure Controls and 
Procedures</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>As of the end of the period covered by this 
Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q, an evaluation was carried out under the 
supervision of, and with the participation of the Chief Executive Officer 
(&#147;CEO&#148;) and Principal Financial Officer (&#147;PFO&#148;), of the 
effectiveness of the design and operations of our disclosure controls and 
procedures (as defined in Rule 13a-15(e) under the Securities Exchange Act of 
1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;). Based on that evaluation, the 
CEO and the PFO have concluded that as of the end of the period covered by this 
Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q, our disclosure controls and procedures were 
effective in ensuring that (i) information required to be disclosed by us in the
reports that we file or submit under the Exchange Act is recorded, processed, 
summarized and reported within the time periods specified in the SEC&#146;s 
rules and forms and (ii) information required to be disclosed by us in the
reports that we file or submit under the Exchange Act is accumulated and 
communicated to our CEO and PFO, as appropriate to allow timely decisions 
regarding required disclosure.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><B>Changes in Internal Controls</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>During the second quarter of 2016, in 
response to the reduction in staff, we modified our internal control over 
financial reporting in order to maintain the integrity of those controls 
impacted by the reduction of staff. Management believes that the controls have 
been successfully implemented and are functioning as required to provide timely 
and accurate financial reporting. &nbsp;There has been no other change in our 
internal control over financial reporting during the quarter ended June 30, 
2016, that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially 
affect, our internal control over financial reporting.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<A NAME="_Toc316545027"></A><A NAME="_Toc449456277"></A><A 
NAME="_Toc449520381"></A><P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12.2px" 
align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center>12</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="margin-bottom:9.6px; padding-top:9.6px" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="margin:0px; page-break-before:always" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12.2px" align=justify><FONT style="font-
family:'Times New Roman Bold,Times New Roman'"><B>PART II &#150; OTHER 
INFORMATION</B></FONT></P>
<A NAME="_Toc316545028"></A><A NAME="_Toc449456278"></A><A 
NAME="_Toc449520382"></A><P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:6.667px" 
align=justify><FONT style="font-family:'Times New Roman Bold,Times New 
Roman'"><B>ITEM 1. &nbsp;LEGAL PROCEEDINGS</B></FONT></P>
<A NAME="_Toc316545029"></A><P style="margin:0px" align=justify>We are not aware
of any material pending or threatened litigation or of any proceedings known to 
be contemplated by governmental authorities that are, or would be, likely to 
have a material adverse effect upon us or our operations, taken as a whole.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<A NAME="_Toc449456279"></A><A NAME="_Toc449520383"></A><P style="margin-
top:0px; margin-bottom:12.2px" align=justify><FONT style="font-family:'Times New
Roman Bold,Times New Roman'"><B>ITEM 1A. &nbsp;RISK FACTORS</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>There were no material changes to the risk 
factors disclosed in Item 1A of Part I in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the
period ended December 31, 2015.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<A NAME="_Toc316545030"></A><A NAME="_Toc449456280"></A><A 
NAME="_Toc449520384"></A><P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:12.2px" 
align=justify><FONT style="font-family:'Times New Roman Bold,Times New 
Roman'"><B>ITEM 2. &nbsp;UNREGISTERED SALES OF EQUITY SECURITIES AND USE OF 
PROCEEDS</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>None. </P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<A NAME="_Toc316545031"></A><A NAME="_Toc449456281"></A><A 
NAME="_Toc449520385"></A><P style="margin:0px" align=justify><FONT style="font-
family:'Times New Roman Bold,Times New Roman'"><B>ITEM 3. &nbsp;DEFAULTS UPON 
SENIOR SECURITIES</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>None.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<A NAME="_Toc316545032"></A><A NAME="_Toc449456282"></A><A 
NAME="_Toc449520386"></A><P style="margin:0px" align=justify><FONT style="font-
family:'Times New Roman Bold,Times New Roman'"><B>ITEM 4. &nbsp;MINE SAFETY 
DISCLOSURES</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>We consider health, safety and environmental
stewardship to be a core value for Rare Element.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>Pursuant to Section 1503(a) of the Dodd-
Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (the &#147;Dodd-Frank 
Act&#148;), issuers that are operators, or that have a subsidiary that is an 
operator, of a coal or other mine in the United States are required to disclose 
in their periodic reports filed with the SEC information regarding specified 
health and safety violations, orders and citations, related assessments and 
legal actions, and mining-related fatalities under the regulation of the Federal
Mine Safety and Health Administration (&#147;MSHA&#148;) under the Federal Mine 
Safety and Health Act of 1977 (the &#147;Mine Act&#148;). During the period 
ended June 30, 2016, the Bear Lodge REE Project was not yet in production and as
such, was not subject to regulation by MSHA under the Mine Act.</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<A NAME="_Toc316545033"></A><A NAME="_Toc449456283"></A><A 
NAME="_Toc449520387"></A><P style="margin:0px" align=justify><FONT style="font-

INFORMATION</B></FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=justify>None.</P>

<DESCRIPTION>CERTIFICATION
<TEXT>
<!doctype html public "-//IETF//DTD HTML//EN">
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>CERTIFICATION</TITLE>
<META NAME="author" CONTENT="nonesuch">
<META NAME="date" CONTENT="08/08/2016">
</HEAD>
<BODY style="margin-top:0;font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:10pt; 
color:#000000">
<A NAME="ziRedlineTmp"></A><P style="margin:0px">Exhibit 31.1</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><B>CERTIFICATIONS</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px">I, Randall J. Scott, certify that:</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
float:left">1.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px">I have reviewed this 
Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q of Rare Element Resources Ltd.;</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
float:left">2.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px">Based on my 
knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact 
or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light
of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with 
respect to the period covered by this report; </P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
float:left">3.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px">Based on my 
knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in
this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, 
results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the 
periods presented in this report; </P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
float:left">4.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px">The registrant&#146;s
other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining 
disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) 
and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in 
Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:72px; width:96px; 
float:left">a.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:-2px">Designed such 
disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and 
procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material 
information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries,
is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the 
period in which this report is being prepared;</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:72px; width:96px; 
float:left">b.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:-2px">Designed such 
internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over 
financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable 
assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation 
of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally 
accepted accounting principles;</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:72px; width:96px; 
float:left">c.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:-2px">Evaluated the 
effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and 
presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the 
disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this 
report based on such evaluation; and</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:72px; width:96px; 
float:left">d.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:-2px">Disclosed in this 
report any change in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial 
reporting that occurred during the registrant&#146;s most recent fiscal quarter 
(the registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) 
that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the 
registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
float:left">5.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px">The registrant&#146;s
other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent 
evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the 
registrant&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#146;s 
board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:72px; width:96px; 
float:left">a.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:-2px">All significant 
deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal 
control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect
the registrant&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial
information; and</P>
<A NAME="_GoBack"></A><P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:72px; width:96px; 
float:left">b.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:96px; text-indent:-2px">Any fraud, whether or
not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant
role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE style="margin-top:0px; font-size:10pt" cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0><TR

<HEAD>
<TITLE>CERTIFICATION</TITLE>

<BODY style="margin-top:0;font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:10pt; 
color:#000000">
<A NAME="ziRedlineTmp"></A><P style="margin:0px; font-size:12pt">Exhibit 
32.1</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-size:12pt" align=center><B>CERTIFICATION OF THE CHIEF
EXECUTIVE OFFICER</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-size:12pt" align=center><B>PURSUANT TO 18 U.S.C. 
SECTION 1350</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-size:12pt" align=center><B>AS ADOPTED PURSUANT 
TO</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-size:12pt" align=center><B>SECTION 906 OF THE 
SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:48px; font-size:12pt">Pursuant to Section 906 
of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 (Section 1350 of Chapter 63 of Title 18 of the
United States Code), the undersigned officer of Rare Element Resources Ltd. (the
&#147;Company&#148;) does hereby certify, based on my knowledge, with respect to
the Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q of the Company for the period ended June 30, 
2016 (the &#147;Report&#148;) that:</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
font-size:12pt; float:left">1.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; font-size:12pt">The 
Report fully complies with the requirements of Section 13(a) or Section 15(d) of
the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
font-size:12pt; float:left">2.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; font-size:12pt">The 
information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, 
the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-size:12pt; clear:left">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-size:12pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE style="margin-top:0px; font-size:10pt" cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0><TR

<DESCRIPTION>CERTIFICATION
<TEXT>

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>CERTIFICATION</TITLE>
<META NAME="author" CONTENT="Ashlie Thorburn">
<META NAME="date" CONTENT="08/08/2016">
</HEAD>
<BODY style="margin-top:0;font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:10pt; 
color:#000000">
<A NAME="ziRedlineTmp"></A><P style="margin:0px; font-size:12pt">Exhibit 
32.2</P>
<P style="margin:0px" align=center><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-size:12pt" align=center><B>CERTIFICATION OF THE 
PRINCIPAL FINANCIAL OFFICER </B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-size:12pt" align=center><B>PURSUANT TO 18 U.S.C. 
SECTION 1350</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-size:12pt" align=center><B>AS ADOPTED PURSUANT 
TO</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-size:12pt" align=center><B>SECTION 906 OF THE 
SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002</B></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:48px; font-size:12pt">Pursuant to Section 906 
of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 (Section 1350 of Chapter 63 of Title 18 of the
United States Code), the undersigned officer of Rare Element Resources Ltd. (the
&#147;Company&#148;) does hereby certify, based on my knowledge, with respect to
the Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q of the Company for the period ended June 30, 
2016 (the &#147;Report&#148;) that:</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
font-size:12pt; float:left">1.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; font-size:12pt">The 
Report fully complies with the requirements of Section 13(a) or Section 15(d) of
the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and</P>
<P style="margin:0px; clear:left"><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:-2px; text-indent:24px; width:48px; 
font-size:12pt; float:left">2.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; padding-left:48px; text-indent:-2px; font-size:12pt">The 
information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, 
the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-size:12pt; clear:left">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-size:12pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE style="margin-top:0px; font-size:10pt" cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0><TR 
height=0 style="font-size:0"><TD width=292 /><TD width=332 /></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-
right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px" width=292><P style="margin:0px; padding-
left:9.6px; padding-right:9.6px; font-size:12pt">&nbsp;</P></TD><TD 
style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-right:9.6px;
padding-bottom:0px" width=332><P style="margin:0px; font-size:12pt">/s/ Adria 
Hutchison </P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-
right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px" valign=top width=292><P style="margin:0px; 
font-size:12pt">Date: August 8, 2016 
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&n
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>
</TD><TD style="margin-top:0px; padding-left:9.6px; padding-top:0px; padding-
right:9.6px; padding-bottom:0px" valign=top width=332><P style="margin:0px; 
font-

&nbsp;&nbsp;</U></P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-size:12pt">Adria Hutchison</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-size:12pt">(Principal Financial Officer)</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0px; text-indent:48px; font-size:12pt">The foregoing 
certification is being furnished solely pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-
Oxley Act of 2002 (Section 1350 of Chapter 63 of Title 18 of the United States 
Code). &nbsp;It shall not be deemed filed for purposes of Section 18 of the 
Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (15 U.S.C. Section 78r) or otherwise subject to 
the liability of that section. &nbsp;It shall also not be deemed incorporated by
reference into any filing under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended,
or the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, except to the extent that the Company
specifically incorporates it by reference. &nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0px; font-size:12pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="margin:0px"><BR>

    <us-gaap:NatureOfOperations contextRef="From2016-01-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0.2pt 0 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;Rare Element Resources Ltd. 
(collectively,&#13;&amp;#147;we,&amp;#148; &amp;#147;us,&amp;#148; 
&amp;#147;Rare Element&amp;#148; or the &amp;#147;Company&amp;#148;) was 
incorporated under the laws of&#13;the Province of British Columbia, Canada, on 
June 3, 1999.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0 0.2pt 0 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;Rare Element 
has historically been&#13;focused on advancing the Bear Lodge Rare Earth Element
(&amp;#147;REE&amp;#148;) Project located near the town of Sundance in 
northeast&#13;Wyoming. The Bear Lodge REE Project consists of several large 
disseminated REE deposits and a proposed hydrometallurgical plant&#13;to be 
located near Upton, Wyoming. The Company previously announced extensive cost 
cutting measures and the placement of the Project&#13;on care-and-maintenance to
position us to be able to move the Project forward when market conditions 
improve, while allowing us&#13;in the interim to pursue potential financings and
strategic alternatives such as off-take agreements, joint ventures and the 
potential&#13;sale of various assets and/or the Bear Lodge REE 
Project.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;The financial
statements have been&#13;prepared on a going concern basis, which assumes the 
Company will be able to realize its assets and discharge its liabilities 
in&#13;the normal course of business for the foreseeable future. The Company has
incurred losses since inception and further losses are&#13;anticipated in the 
development of its business, raising substantial doubt about the 
Company&amp;#146;s ability to continue as a going&#13;concern. The ability to 
continue as a going concern is dependent upon the Company obtaining the 
necessary financing to meet its&#13;obligations and pay its liabilities arising 
from normal business operations when they come due. Management intends to 
finance operating&#13;costs with existing cash on hand, asset sales and 
potential issuances of common stock. There can be no assurance that we will 
be&#13;able to raise the necessary financing or complete a strategic transaction
on acceptable terms or at all. If we are unable to continue&#13;as a going 
concern or in order to preserve shareholder value, we may have to liquidate our 
assets. If the Company decides to sell&#13;part or all of its assets, the sale 
proceeds may be less than the value at which those assets are carried on our 
consolidated financial&#13;statements. As a result, investors may lose part or 
all of their investment.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:NatureOfOperations>
    <us-gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock 
contextRef="From2016-01-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0 0.2pt 0 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;In accordance 
with U.S. GAAP&#13;for interim financial statements, these consolidated 
financial statements do not include certain information and note 
disclosures&#13;that are normally included in annual financial statements 
prepared in conformity with U.S. GAAP. Accordingly, these unaudited 
consolidated&#13;financial statements should be read in conjunction with our 
audited consolidated financial statements as of December 31, 2015,&#13;which 
were included in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the period ended December 
31, 2015. In the opinion of management, the&#13;accompanying unaudited 
consolidated financial statements contain all adjustments (which are of a 
normal, recurring nature) necessary&#13;to present fairly in all material 
respects our financial position as of June 30, 2016, and the results of our 
operations and cash&#13;flows for the six months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015 in
conformity with U.S. GAAP. Interim results of operations for the three&#13;and 
six months ended June 30, 2016 may not be indicative of results that will be 
realized for the full year ending December 
31,&#13;2016.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0 0.2pt 0 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0.2pt 0 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Recent Accounting 
Pronouncements&#13;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0.2pt 0 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0.2pt 0 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;In August
2014, the Financial&#13;Accounting Standards Board (&amp;#147;FASB&amp;#148;) 
issued Accounting Standards Update (&amp;#147;ASU&amp;#148;) No. 2014-15, 
&amp;#147;Presentation&#13;of Financial Statements-Going Concern (Subtopic 205-
40): Disclosure of Uncertainties about an Entity&amp;#146;s Ability to
Continue&#13;as a Going Concern&amp;#148; (&amp;#147;ASU 2014-15&amp;#148;). ASU
2014-15 is intended to define management&amp;#146;s responsibility to 
evaluate&#13;whether there is substantial doubt about an organization&amp;#146;s
ability to continue as a going concern and to provide related&#13;footnote 
disclosures. The amendments in this ASU are effective for reporting periods 
beginning after December 15, 2016, with early&#13;adoption permitted. Although 
we have not yet adopted ASU 2014-15, we plan to do so timely and will then 
determine if additional&#13;disclosures are required. We do not expect its 
adoption to have a material impact on our financial statements.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentTextBlock contextRef="From2016-01-
01to2016-06-30">&lt;table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-
collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times,

style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times,

center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;June 30, 2016&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="padding-bottom: 1pt; font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style="padding-

outstanding warrant is exercisable&#13;for one of the Company&amp;#146;s common
shares and was issued to investors in connection with registered direct 
offerings of the&#13;Company that closed on September 27, 2013 and April 29, 
2015. In addition, the Company issued warrants to a placement agent 
in&#13;connection with each offering, under the same terms as those issued to 
investors. The exercise price and exercise period are

    <us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock 
contextRef="From2016-01-01to2016-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;Our commitments and 
contingencies&#13;include the following item:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0.2pt 0 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Potential environmental 
contingency&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="letter-spacing: 
-0.1pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="letter-spacing: -0.1pt"&gt;Our&#13;mining and 
exploration activities are subject to various federal and state laws and 
regulations governing the protection of the&#13;environment. These laws and 
regulations are continually changing and generally becoming more restrictive 
over time. The Company&#13;conducts its operations so as to protect public 
health and the environment and believes its operations are materially in 
compliance&#13;with all applicable laws and regulations. We have made, and 
expect to make in the future, expenditures to comply with such laws&#13;and 
regulations. The ultimate amount of reclamation and other future site-
restoration costs to be incurred for existing mining&#13;interests is 
uncertain.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock>
    <REE:AdditionalPaidInCapitalDisclosure contextRef="From2016-01-01to2016-06-
30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; 
text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Stock-based 
compensation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0.2pt 0 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;We have 
options outstanding and exercisable&#13;that were issued under two plans, the 
Fixed Stock Option Plan (&amp;#147;FSOP&amp;#148;) and the 10% Rolling Stock 
Option Plan (&amp;#147;RSOP&amp;#148;).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;The FSOP was 
originally approved&#13;by shareholders on December 11, 2002, and subsequently 
approved by shareholders on December 7, 2009 following certain amendments&#13;to
the FSOP. The FSOP expired upon the adoption of the RSOP that was approved by 
shareholders on December 2, 2011, and as such,&#13;we may no longer grant 
options under the FSOP. However, the terms of the FSOP continue to govern all 
prior awards granted under&#13;such plan until such awards have been cancelled, 
forfeited or exercised in accordance with the terms thereof. As of June 30, 
2016,&#13;we had 160,000 options outstanding under our FSOP, as amended, and 
3,127,400 options outstanding under our RSOP.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; text-
align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; text-align: justify"&gt;The fair 
value of each employee stock&#13;option award is estimated at the grant date 
using a Black-Scholes option pricing model and the price of our common shares on
the&#13;date of grant. The Company did not issue any stock option awards during
the six months ended June 30, 2016. The significant assumptions&#13;used to 
estimate the fair value of stock options awarded during the six months ended 
June 30, 2015, using a Black-Scholes option&#13;pricing model are as 
follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" align="center" style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
width: 70%; border-collapse: collapse"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="background-color: 
white; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
nowrap="nowrap" style="width: 58%; padding-right: 5.4pt; padding-left: 5.4pt;

compensation expense recognized&#13;in our consolidated financial statements for
the three months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015 for stock option awards was $23 
and&#13;$48, respectively, and $56 and $130 for the six months ended June 30, 
2016 and 2015, respectively. As of June 30, 2016, there was&#13;$17 of total 
unrecognized compensation cost related to 264,200 unvested stock options that is
expected to be recognized over a&#13;weighted-average remaining vesting period 
of 0.4 years.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times,

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>This is focus fiscal period of the document report. For a 
first quarter 2006 quarterly report, which may also provide financial 
information from prior periods, the first fiscal quarter should be given as the 
fiscal period focus. Values: FY, Q1, Q2, Q3, Q4, H1, H2, M9, T1, T2, T3, M8, 
CY.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData"

gaap_AccountsPayableAndAccruedLiabilitiesCurrent">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Sum of the carrying values as of the balance sheet date of
obligations incurred through that date and due within one year (or the operating
cycle, if longer), including liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have 
typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received,
taxes, interest, rent and utilities, accrued salaries and bonuses, payroll taxes
and fringe benefits.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+

http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-
122682<br></p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AccountsReceivableNetCurrent">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount due from customers or clients, within one year of 
the balance sheet date (or the normal operating cycle, whichever is longer), for
goods or services (including trade receivables) that have been delivered or sold
in the normal course of business, reduced to the estimated net realizable fair 
value by an allowance established by the entity of the amount it deems uncertain
of collection.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+

http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name 
Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData"
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AdditionalPaidInCapital">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Excess of issue price over par or stated value of the 
entity's capital stock and amounts received from other transactions involving 
the entity's stock or stockholders. Includes adjustments to additional paid in 
capital. Some examples of such adjustments include recording the issuance of 
debt with a beneficial conversion feature and certain tax consequences of equity
instruments awarded to employees. Use this element for the aggregate amount of 
additional paid-in capital associated with common and preferred stock. For 
additional paid-in capital associated with only common stock, use the element 
additional paid in capital, common stock. For additional paid-in capital 
associated with only preferred stock, use the element additional paid in 
capital, preferred stock.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name 
Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section 
S99<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-02.30(a)(1))<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-
122682<br><br>Reference 2: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher SEC<br> -Name Regulation S-X (SX)<br> -Number 210<br> -Section 02<br>
-Paragraph 31<br> -Article 5<br></p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_AssetRetirementObligationCurrent">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Current portion of the carrying amount of a liability for 
an asset retirement obligation. An asset retirement obligation is a legal 
obligation associated with the disposal or retirement of a tangible long-lived 
asset that results from the acquisition, construction or development, or the 
normal operations of a long-lived asset, except for certain obligations of 
lessees.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name 
Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 410<br> -SubTopic 20<br> -Section 
50<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (c)<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6392692&amp;loc=d3e7535-110849<br></p></div>

<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date 
of all assets that are recognized. Assets are probable future economic benefits 
obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past transactions or 
events.</p></div>

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date 
of all assets that are expected to be realized in cash, sold, or consumed within
one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer). Assets are probable future 
economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past 
transactions or events.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_CashAndCashEquivalentsAtCarryingValue">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with
banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the 
general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly 
liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash 
and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in 
value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents 
within disposal group and discontinued operation.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name 
Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Glossary Cash<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6506951<br><br>Reference 2: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name 
Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section 
45<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (a)<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=28358313&amp;loc=d3e6676-
107765<br><br>Reference 3: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 230<br> 
-SubTopic 10<br> -Section 45<br> -Paragraph 4<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=56944662&amp;loc=d3e3044-
108585<br><br>Reference 4: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Glossary Cash 
Equivalents<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6507016<br><br>Reference 5:

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_CommitmentsAndContingencies">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Represents the caption on the face of the balance sheet to
indicate that the entity has entered into (1) purchase or supply arrangements 
that will require expending a portion of its resources to meet the terms 
thereof, and (2) is exposed to potential losses or, less frequently, gains, 
arising from (a) possible claims against a company's resources due to future 
performance under contract terms, and (b) possible losses or likely gains from 
uncertainties that will ultimately be resolved when one or more future events 
that are deemed likely to occur do occur or fail to occur.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1:
